about_the_game:
The Baltimore & Ohio was America’ oldest railroad – and among its most dynamic, glamorous, and memorable railroads. And now, the classic Baltimore & Ohio comes to life on the highly acclaimed Train Simulator B&O Mountain Subdivision route – with B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack!

Created by High Iron Simulations, B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack delivers all the captivating experiences and challenges of B&O railroading in the 1960s, as first-generation diesels battle the railroad’s historic crossing of the Allegheny Mountains.

B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack includes four types of diesel locomotives, in multiple variations and a variety of authentic liveries:

  • B&O’s legendary Electro-Motive F7 (cab and booster) is featured in four liveries: “As delivered” magnificent B&O blue, gray, and black; Simplified blue and black of circa 1961; the B&O’s distinctive “Sunburst” livery of circa 1963; and B&O’s “Capitol” blue scheme of circa 1966.
  • B&O’s stylish and hard-hauling Baldwin RF16 “Sharknose” diesel (cab and booster) wears the blue-and-black livery the exotic units wore throughout the 1960s.
  • B&O’s landmark GP7 road-switcher is included in passenger and freight variations (with and without steam generators) and multiple liveries.
  • B&O’s GP9 diesel workhorse is included in passenger and freight versions (with and without steam generators and dynamic brakes) and multiple liveries.

Each of the locomotives in B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack feature the advanced and authentic air braking systems as debuted with the B&O Mountain Subdivision route.

Joining the diverse motive power in B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack is a selection of freight rolling stock, including B&O’s famed Class I-5 wooden caboose in no less than seven livery and detail variations. And B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack will put you right to work on the tough and unrelenting grades of the B&O Mountain Subdivision with ten realistic career scenarios that include manifest, coal, local freight, and switching assignments!

Note: The locomotives and equipment of B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack can be used on a variety of Train Simulator routes. The included scenarios require the B&O Mountain Subdivision route (route available separately).

Climb aboard and take the throttle of Baltimore & Ohio’s magnificent diesel motive power and enjoy 1960s railroading amid the rugged and scenic Allegheny Mountains – with B&O Mountain Subdivision Retro Pack for Train Simulator!

Included Scenarios


Ten realistic and challenging career scenarios representing Baltimore & Ohio operations of the 1960s are included, putting you at the throttle of B&O motive power for mainline, local, and switching operations on the Train Simulator B&O Mountain Subdivision route. The pack is also Quick Drive compatible and features a variety of B&O Quick Drive consists.

  • [BO 1.01] B&O's Advance Manhattan, Pt. 1
  • [BO 1.02] B&O's Advance Manhattan, Pt. 2
  • [BO 1.03] B&O's Advance Manhattan, Pt. 3
  • [BO 1.04] B&O's Advance Manhattan, Pt. 4
  • [BO 1.05] Austen Coal Pick Up
  • [BO 1.06] Local To Keyser
  • [BO 1.07] West Virginia Northern Interchange
  • [BO 1.08] One Fancy Switch Engine
  • [BO 1.09] Covered Wagons Westbound
  • [BO 1.10] King Coal

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Baltimore & Ohio EMD F7A and F7B in four authentic liveries
  • Baltimore & Ohio Baldwin RF16 (cab and booster) “Sharknose” diesel in blue and black livery
  • Baltimore & Ohio EMD GP7 in passenger and freight versions and multiple liveries
  • Baltimore & Ohio EMD GP9 in passenger and freight versions and multiple liveries
  • B&O wooden Class I-5 cupola caboose in seven livery/detail variations
  • Freight equipment including boxcars, hoppers, refrigerator cars, and tank cars
  • Ten realistic and challenging career scenarios for use on the B&O Mountain Subdivision route
  • Quick Drive compatible
  • Download size: 0.00mb

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32- or 64-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i5 4690 3.50 GHz Quad Core or AMD Ryzen 7 1700 3.80 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM (maximum possible under 32-bit Windows)/16 GB or Better (For 64-bit Windows)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 970 or AMD Radeon RX 480 with 4 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: High Performance SSD Recommended with 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator 2022 User Guide.
